algebraic_word_problem: A train leaves station A traveling at 60 mph and another train leaves station B 2 hours later traveling at 75 mph. When will the second train catch up?
step_by_step_solution: Let t be the time in hours the first train travels. Distance = speed × time. Distance of first train = 60t. Distance of second train = 75(t - 2). Set the distances equal: 60t = 75(t - 2). Solving gives t = 8, so the second train catches up 6 hours after it leaves.
